ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants to learn Portuguese.

I would highly recommend this class to anyone who speaks another romance language fairly well. Portuguese is not a class that is studied by many, but there is no reason to not take it if you have any sort of interest. I would say the workload is pretty heavy, but it provides a solid foundation to continue studying the language during your time at Yale.
Absolutely - if you're interested in learning Portuguese, it's a great course.
I would definitely recommend Portuguese 112 to anyone with even the faintest interest in Portuguese and Brazilian and Portuguese culture.
Anyone interested in learning Portuguese--absolutely. You will never have a better opportunity to learn the language (aside from going to Brazil, I suspect).
